texto: Explainability Laboratory for Artificial IntelligenceInstitute of Informatics â€“ UFRGSWHO WE AREExpLAIn is a research group at the Institute of Informatics, UFRGS, dedicated to making artificial intelligence more understandable, reliable, and responsible.RESEARCHOur research areas include:ğŸ§© Interpretable machine learningğŸ§¬ Biomarker discovery and AI for biologyâš™ï¸ Evolutionary optimization of neural networksğŸŒ Relevance visualization and analysisSUPERVISIONThe laboratory is coordinated by Prof. Bruno Iochins Grisci (PhD in Computer Science), a researcher in Artificial Intelligence, Bioinformatics, and Evolutionary Computation.MISSIONTo create methods and tools that explain how AI models learn, decide, and fail, making them more transparent, trustworthy, and useful for science and society.CONNECT WITH USğŸ“ Instituto de InformÃ¡tica â€“ UFRGS, Porto Alegre, BrasilğŸ“§ Contact and links in bio

Hoje tive a oportunidade â€” e a incrÃ­vel responsabilidade â€” de representar a Ã¡rea de Warehouse na Innovation Week 2025 daEricsson. Durante essa semana, alguns projetos do site sÃ£o apresentados para o LT com o objetivo de compartilhar boas ideias e promover a troca de iniciativas entre os diferentes sites.Apresentei o AIMR (Automated Incoming Material Registration), um projeto no qual desenvolvemos e treinamos localmente um modelo de aprendizado de mÃ¡quina capaz de prever informaÃ§Ãµes faltantes de rastreabilidade de componentes eletrÃ´nicos. Com isso, conseguimos reduzir o lead time de retrabalho para apenas 10 segundos e atingimos o recorde histÃ³rico do site: 99,99% de consistÃªncia nos dados! O operador de estoque agora nÃ£o precisa realizar nenhuma anÃ¡lise complexa, nem segregar rolos ou enviar um Ãºnico e-mail!Sinto um enorme orgulho da flexibilidade e liberdade que a Ericsson proporciona para testar novas ideias, propor mudanÃ§as e colher seus resultados. Nas palavras do nosso head,Rodrigo Dienstmann:â€œNÃ³s somos curiosos e inconformados por natureza!â€Isso Ã© serEricsson, isso Ã© ser Operations, e isso Ã© imaginar o possÃ­vel.70 anos de produÃ§Ã£o no Brasil, 86 anos de presenÃ§a no paÃ­s e 149 anos de existÃªncia â€” sempre com uma filosofia: InovaÃ§Ã£o.======================ENGLISH======================Today, I had the amazing opportunity and responsibility to represent the Warehouse area at Ericssonâ€™s Innovation Week 2025. During this week, several site projects are showcased to the LT with the goal of sharing great ideas and fostering collaboration across different locations.I presented the AIMR (Automated Incoming Material Registration), a project where we developed and trained a machine learning model locally to predict missing traceability information of electronic components. As a result, we reduced rework lead time to just 10 seconds and achieved the siteâ€™s all-time performance record: 99.99% data consistency! Now, the warehouse operator doesnâ€™t need to perform complex analyses, segregate reels, or send a single email!Iâ€™m truly proud of the flexibility and freedom Ericsson gives us to try new things, propose changes, and see them bear fruit. In the words of our head,Rodrigo Dienstmann:â€œWe are curious and nonconformist by nature!â€Thatâ€™s what it means to beEricsson, to be Operations, and to imagine possible.70 years of production in Brazil, 86 years of presence in the country, and 149 years of existence â€” all driven by one philosophy: Innovation.Muito obrigadoLeandro Toss Hoffmannpor todas as aulas e por me apresentar o incrÃ­vel universo da AI, espero que seja o primeiro de muitos projetos.Muito obrigadoIlana Cotrimpor todo o suporte e pelo incrÃ­vel trabalho da Ã¡rea de comunicaÃ§Ãµes!

Illegal logging continues to threaten the Amazonâ€™s rich biodiversity, local communities, and economic stability. But thereâ€™s a powerful shift underway.The Forest Fingerprints project, supported in part byThe Nature Conservancy Brasil, is harnessing the power of chemical analysis, AI, and machine learning to trace the true origin of timber. In one study, researchers analyzed 67 trees across 21 sites using strontium isotopes, uncovering a strong connection between wood chemistry and local geology. This breakthrough could help verify timber sources and support more transparent, sustainable forest management.While more data is needed to refine the method, this innovative approach offers real promise for protecting the Amazon and ensuring its resources are used legally and responsibly.Science is giving forests a voice. Letâ€™s listen and act.Read the full study below and also check out the Digital Forests webpage herehttps://lnkd.in/e6cxVvBn

Read Your OEE Like a Prohttps://lnkd.in/g_aJAB55OEE is one of the most misunderstood metrics in manufacturing. Many track itâ€”few transform with it.When measured correctly and visualized properly, OEE becomes a continuous improvement compass. It helps you see how effectively equipment is utilized, how performance fluctuates, and how process stability evolves over time.The benefit of this spreadsheet is its clarity. It translates raw daily data into structured insights, turning hundreds of shift records into visible performance patterns. With it, teams can identify loss trends, compare machines, and focus efforts where improvement truly matters.Each number in the dashboard represents a learning opportunity.When reviewing OEE data regularly, you drive accountability, align priorities, and strengthen the link between maintenance, production, and quality performance.OEE is not just a measurementâ€”itâ€™s a mirror of operational discipline and a tool for driving focused improvement across every level of the plant.

Saludos a todos,A continuaciÃ³n, informaciÃ³n para descargar el nuevo paper publicado:WeldVGG: A VGG-Inspired Deep Learning Model for Weld Defect Classification from Radiographic Images with Visual InterpretabilityAuthors:Gabriel LÃ³pez 1,Pablo Duque RamÃ­rez 2,*, Emanuel Vega 1, Felix Pizarro 2, Joaquin Toro 1 and Carlos Parra 2Link para descargar  el paper:https://lnkd.in/eMsdHZAehttps://lnkd.in/edYsE9TH1 Escuela de IngenierÃ­a InformÃ¡tica, Pontificia Universidad CatÃ³lica de ValparaÃ­so (PUCV), Av. Brasil 2241, ValparaÃ­so 2362807, Chile2 Departamento de MecÃ¡nica, Universidad TÃ©cnica Federico Santa MarÃ­a, Av. Federico Sta. MarÃ­a 6090, ViÃ±a del Mar 2520000, ChileSensors 2025, 25(19), 6183;https://lnkd.in/eyJgg6XbThis research was funded by: UNIVERSIDAD TÃ‰CNICA FEDERICO SANTA MARÃA. PROYECTO DE INNOVACIÃ“N-03-2025. Departamento de MecÃ¡nica.AbstractVisual inspection remains a cornerstone of quality control in welded structures, yet manual evaluations are inherently constrained by subjectivity, inconsistency, and limited scalability. This study presents WeldVGG, a deep learning-based visual inspection model designed to automate weld defect classification using radiographic imagery. The proposed model is trained on the RIAWELC dataset, a publicly available collection of X-ray weld images acquired in real manufacturing environments and annotated across four defect conditions: cracking, porosity, lack of penetration, and no defect. RIAWELC offers high-resolution imagery and standardized class labels, making it a valuable benchmark for defect classification under realistic conditions. To improve trust and explainability, Grad-CAM++ is employed to generate class-discriminative saliency maps, enabling visual validation of predictions. The model is rigorously evaluated through stratified cross-validation and benchmarked against traditional machine learning baselines, including SVC, Random Forest, and a state-of-the-art architecture, MobileNetV3. The proposed model achieves high classification accuracy and interpretability, offering a practical and scalable solution for intelligent weld inspection.........Keywords: weld inspection; radiographic inspection; convolutional neural network; visual testing; industrial AI; Grad-CAM++; interpretability; weld defect classification

Beyond Tools, Toward Power Structures: A Critical Review of AI in Primary EducationArtificial Intelligence is rapidly entering primary education, often framed as a neutral or purely technical innovation. But what happens when we look beyond the tools â€”and examine AI as a power structure?In this article, we (Ana Yara Postigo Fuentes,Amaia Arroyo Sagasta, PhDand myself ) critically review 23 primary studies on AI in primary education using the framework â€œDimensions for Analysing AIâ€™s Impact on Educationâ€ (CastaÃ±eda et al., forthcoming hopefully this year). This multidimensional lens â€”instrumental, epistemological, ethical, social, political, commercial, and ideologicalâ€” helps us reveal what current research highlights, and what it systematically overlooks.The results show strong imbalances: instrumental, ethical, and social dimensions dominate the field, while commercial and ideological ones remain marginal. AI continues to be portrayed as a technical fix with moral overtones rather than a complex socio-political actor shaping classrooms, policies, and markets.We argue for a more integrated, critically informed collaboration among educators, families, researchers, industry, and policymakersâ€”so that AI serves educational justice and democratic participation, instead of reinforcing existing inequalities.The article is available in English only:https://lnkd.in/dPMrF7iW______________________Entre las herramientas y las estructuras de poder: una revisiÃ³n crÃ­tica de la inteligencia artificial en la educaciÃ³n primariaLa inteligencia artificial estÃ¡ entrando en la educaciÃ³n primaria envuelta en promesas de innovaciÃ³n y eficiencia. Pero Â¿quÃ© ocurre cuando miramos mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de su uso instrumental y la entendemos tambiÃ©n como una estructura de poder?En este artÃ­culo, publicado solo en inglÃ©s,Ana Yara Postigo Fuentes,Amaia Arroyo Sagasta, PhDy yo misma, analizamos crÃ­ticamente 23 estudios sobre IA en educaciÃ³n primaria utilizando el marco â€œDimensions for Analysing AIâ€™s Impact on Educationâ€ (CastaÃ±eda et al.,que saldrÃ¡ este mismo aÃ±o). Este enfoque multidimensional â€”instrumental, epistemolÃ³gico, Ã©tico, social, polÃ­tico, comercial e ideolÃ³gicoâ€” permite observar no solo quÃ© aspectos destaca la literatura actual, sino tambiÃ©n quÃ© deja sistemÃ¡ticamente fuera.Los resultados muestran un claro desequilibrio: las dimensiones instrumental, Ã©tica y social son las mÃ¡s tratadas, mientras que las comercial e ideolÃ³gica apenas aparecen. La IA sigue viÃ©ndose como una soluciÃ³n tÃ©cnica con tintes morales, mÃ¡s que como un actor socio-polÃ­tico que configura aulas, polÃ­ticas y mercados.Defendemos una colaboraciÃ³n mÃ¡s integrada y crÃ­ticamente informada entre docentes, familias, investigadores, industria y responsables polÃ­ticos, para que la IA contribuya a la justicia educativa y la participaciÃ³n democrÃ¡tica, en lugar de profundizar las desigualdades existentes.

UNESCOâ€™s latest report, "Open Data for AI â€“ What Now?", revisits the Pandemic to remind us that open data is an ethical imperative.Behind every responsible AI model lies a foundation of FAIR data (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, and Reusable).But the report goes further: it outlines a three-phase journey that any nation and any organization can follow to make data openness a living practice:1ï¸âƒ£ PrepareBuild capacity and policies for high-quality, AI-ready data.2ï¸âƒ£ OpenRelease datasets responsibly legally, technically, and culturally.3ï¸âƒ£ Follow upSustain engagement, trust, and long-term reuse.This isnâ€™t about data infrastructure alone. We cannot keep our eyes only on the technology standpoint.ğŸ‘‰ This is about cultivating a culture of openness, where sharing knowledge becomes an act of collective intelligence. ğŸ‘ˆWithout open data, AI remains a mirror of our silos.But with it, we have the chance to build systems that reflect our best values of transparency, inclusion, and accountability.What will be your next movement?I'm reading your comments!--Durante la pandemia aprendimos una lecciÃ³n que va mucho mÃ¡s allÃ¡ de la salud pÃºblica: el conocimiento compartido salva vidas.El Ãºltimo informe de laUNESCOsobre Open Data e IA retoma esa idea con una invitaciÃ³n clara: construir una cultura global de apertura, confianza y cooperaciÃ³n basada en datos FAIR (Findables, Accesibles, Interoperables y Reutilizables).Sin datos abiertos no hay IA responsable.Y sin IA responsable, no hay transformaciÃ³n digital sostenible.El informe propone una hoja de ruta en tres fases para cualquier organizaciÃ³n que aspire a una inteligencia verdaderamente Ã©tica y humana:1ï¸âƒ£ Preparar polÃ­ticas y capacidades para datos de calidad y listos para IA.2ï¸âƒ£ Abrir con transparencia tÃ©cnica y legal, fomentando una cultura de colaboraciÃ³n.3ï¸âƒ£ Dar seguimiento garantizando reutilizaciÃ³n, participaciÃ³n ciudadana y sostenibilidad.El reto no es tÃ©cnico, es cultural.ğŸ‘‰ El futuro de la inteligencia, humana o artificial, dependerÃ¡ de nuestra capacidad para compartir, comprender y cuidar los datos que la alimentan. ğŸ‘ˆY tÃº, Â¿quÃ© vas a hacer al respecto?Â¡Te leo en comentarios!

(EN) Artificial intelligence has made many processes more efficient. However, in professional translation, speed is only valuable when meaning remains intact.An automatic draft may resolve general terminology, but it does not always interpret what sustains the document: an obligation in a contract, a parameter in a technical sheet or a nuance that shapes a decision.At Tradulingua, AI is a useful tool, not a guarantee. Precision comes from human review: analysing context, intent and specialised terminology to confirm the actual function of each part of the text.Technology provides efficiency. Professional judgment provides meaning. The combination works when the final reading is done by someone who understands the language, the field and the implications of each choice.

Esto incluye:â• 1) Un cambio demogrÃ¡fico en Ãfrica tal que en 2050 el 40% de todos los niÃ±os del mundo vivirÃ¡n en Ãfrica[i]Â y para el aÃ±o 2100, el 39% de todos los adultos del mundo vivirÃ¡n en Ãfrica.[ii][iii]â•  2) SubpoblaciÃ³nÂ [iv]en muchas naciones de Asia occidental y oriental,[v]Â creando escasez de mano de obra y la posibilidad de una economÃ­a de estado estable.â•  3) El auge de nuevas tecnologÃ­as como la impresiÃ³n 3D, los drones, la inteligencia artificial, los coches sin conductor aumentan drÃ¡sticamente la productividad, reducen costes y, entre otros impactos, reconocen el diseÃ±o urbano (Â¿por quÃ© plazas de aparcamiento? Â¿o por quÃ© no los coches como casas mÃ³viles?).4) La probable disrupciÃ³n importante en la industria alimentaria mundial a travÃ©s de la agricultura celular â€“ la nueva carne pura y leche pura y el fin de la cadena de suministro de alimentos de origen animal, la posibilidad de un cambio narrativo de los mataderos a los invernaderos y laboratorios de alimentos.Â [vi]5.(...)ğŸ¦¸â€â™€ï¸ To conclude, in times of dramatic change, we donâ€™t simply need better maps of the changing world, we need special powers or super powers to avoid the futures we donâ€™t want and create the futures we do. We need the super power of:(1) Being able to stay calm and focused through meditation;(2) We need the power to learn and reflect instead of acting from unchallenged assumptions and past behavior.(3) We need the superpower to challenge the used future â€“ what we have been doing but no longer works.(4) We need the ability to understand how the world is changing, and the impacts of these disruptions on our day to day life and strategy.(5) We need the superpower to understand and create alternative futures instead of being fixated on one view: one future. This means letting go of the train-track worldview.(6) We need the super-power of narrative, of telling a different story about our lives. And, finally,(7) We need to link story to systemic change, creating a virtuous cycle of change, ensuring that what we value, we count.ğŸ”— en primer comentario

ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ Â¿Tienen impacto los ritmos circadianos en la fertilidad? Cronofertilidad.Un estudio reciente destaca la importancia de los ritmos biolÃ³gicos en varias escalas temporales circadianos (24 horas), infradianos (mÃ¡s de 24 horas) y ultradianos (menos de 24 horas) sobre la funciÃ³n reproductiva humana.ğŸ“Š Datos clave del estudio:â¡La edad media de las mujeres estudiadas fue 32.8 aÃ±os.â¡Se observÃ³ que la sincronizaciÃ³n de los relojes biolÃ³gicos en ovarios y Ãºtero es crucial para la ovulaciÃ³n, calidad ovocitaria y receptividad endometrial.â¡Modelos predictivos basados en inteligencia artificial muestran un Ã¡rea bajo la curva ROC de hasta 0.76 para predicciÃ³n de implantaciÃ³n embrionaria, considerando factores cronobiolÃ³gicos entre otros.â¡Alteraciones en los ritmos biolÃ³gicos, como las producidas por trabajo nocturno o exposiciÃ³n a luz artificial, se asocian a menor Ã©xito reproductivo.â¡La cronobiologÃ­a multi-escala ayuda a entender la heterogeneidad individual y mejora las estrategias personalizadas en reproducciÃ³n asistida.ğŸ’¡ ConclusiÃ³n:Integrar la cronobiologÃ­a en la prÃ¡ctica clÃ­nica y la investigaciÃ³n representa una estrategia innovadora que podrÃ­a transformar el manejo de la infertilidad, optimizando tiempos y tratamientos basados en los ritmos biolÃ³gicos individuales.ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Do circadian rhythms impact fertility? Chronofertility.A recent study highlights the importance of biological rhythms across multiple timescales â€” circadian (24 hours), infradian (more than 24 hours), and ultradian (less than 24 hours) â€” on human reproductive function.ğŸ“Š Key study data:â¡The average age of women studied was 32.8 years.â¡Synchronization of biological clocks in ovaries and uterus is crucial for ovulation, oocyte quality, and endometrial receptivity.â¡Predictive models based on artificial intelligence show an area under the ROC curve up to 0.76 for embryo implantation prediction, considering chronobiological factors among others.â¡Disruptions in biological rhythms, such as those caused by night shift work or artificial light exposure, are associated with lower reproductive success.â¡Multi-scale chronobiology helps understand individual heterogeneity and improves personalized strategies in assisted reproduction.ğŸ’¡ Conclusion:Integrating chronobiology into clinical practice and research represents an innovative strategy that could transform infertility management, optimizing timing and treatments based on individual biological rhythms.

ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ ActualizaciÃ³n GOLD 2026 â€” Principales NovedadesLa nueva versiÃ³n de la GOLD 2026 introduce cambios relevantes en el diagnÃ³stico y manejo de la EPOC. Entre los aspectos mÃ¡s destacados:â€¢ Nueva clasificaciÃ³n fisiolÃ³gica de las exacerbaciones (ROME) incorporando PCR, gasometrÃ­a (PaOâ‚‚, PaCOâ‚‚ con rangos especÃ­ficos), acidosis y escala VAS de disnea.â€¢ Mayor peso de los eosinÃ³filos para decidir tratamiento:â€“ ICS solo si â‰¥100 cÃ©l/ÂµLâ€“ Triple terapia principalmente si â‰¥300 cÃ©l/ÂµLâ€“ Si eos <100, se prioriza azitromicina o roflumilast antes que triple terapia.â€¢ N-acetilcisteÃ­na gana un papel relevante como coadyuvante durante la exacerbaciÃ³n, mejorando sÃ­ntomas e inflamaciÃ³n.â€¢ Nuevo concepto de â€œactividad de la enfermedadâ€, que integra inflamaciÃ³n, exacerbaciones y progresiÃ³n funcional como objetivo terapÃ©utico.â€¢ BiolÃ³gicos, como dupilumab, entran por primera vez en el algoritmo.â€¢ Se incorpora un nuevo capÃ­tulo dedicado a Inteligencia Artificial y tecnologÃ­as emergentes, incluyendo IA para diagnÃ³stico, estratificaciÃ³n de riesgo, anÃ¡lisis de imagen, seguimiento remoto y modelos predictivos.â€¢ Se mantiene el punto de corte FEV1/FVC < 0.70 para diagnÃ³stico, sin adoptar LLN/z-score.Una actualizaciÃ³n que refuerza la personalizaciÃ³n del tratamiento y la integraciÃ³n de biomarcadores, fisiologÃ­a, tecnologÃ­as avanzadas y prevenciÃ³n en el manejo de la EPOC.Estos cambios plantean retos y oportunidades en nuestra prÃ¡ctica clÃ­nica. Â¿CuÃ¡l crees que serÃ¡ el mayor desafÃ­o en su implementaciÃ³n?---ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ GOLD 2026 Update â€” Key HighlightsThe new GOLD 2026 version introduces important updates in COPD diagnosis and management. Key highlights include:â€¢ New physiological ROME classification for exacerbations, incorporating CRP, blood gases (PaOâ‚‚, PaCOâ‚‚ with specific thresholds), acidosis, and the VAS dyspnea scale.â€¢ Stronger reliance on blood eosinophils to guide therapy:â€“ ICS only when â‰¥100 cells/ÂµLâ€“ Triple therapy mainly when â‰¥300 cells/ÂµLâ€“ For eos <100, azithromycin or roflumilast are preferred before escalating to triple therapy.â€¢ N-acetylcysteine gains a more relevant role during acute exacerbations, improving symptoms and inflammatory markers.â€¢ Introduction of the new concept of â€œdisease activityâ€, integrating inflammation, exacerbation burden and functional progression as therapeutic goals.â€¢ Biologic therapies, such as dupilumab, included for the first time in the treatment algorithm.â€¢ A new chapter on Artificial Intelligence and emerging technologies, addressing AI-supported diagnosis, image-based phenotyping, predictive models, and remote monitoring.â€¢ The diagnostic threshold FEV1/FVC < 0.70 is maintained, with no transition to LLN/z-score.A comprehensive update that reinforces personalized treatment and the integration of biomarkers, physiology, and advanced technologies in COPD care.These changes bring new challenges and opportunities. What do you believe will be the biggest barrier to implementing them in clinical practice?

O Segredo da IA de Sucesso NÃ£o EstÃ¡ no Algoritmo, EstÃ¡ nos Dados!Se vocÃª trabalha com Dados ou IA, pare e pense: A IA Ã© tÃ£o boa quanto os dados que a alimentam.Muitas empresas focam apenas em modelos sofisticados, mas a verdade Ã© que o sucesso ou fracasso de uma soluÃ§Ã£o de IA reside na qualidade da nossa matÃ©ria-prima: os dados.A maior parte do trabalho do Cientista de Dados estÃ¡ em garantir que os dados sejam a memÃ³ria e a experiÃªncia corretas para o algoritmo.ğŸ›‘ Evite o "RuÃ­do": 5 Fatores Chave para Dados de Alto ValorSem dados limpos, estruturados e representativos, o aprendizado da IA Ã© apenas ruÃ­do, e o resultado serÃ¡ distorcido.Para implementar uma IA que realmente funcione, precisamos checar 5 aspectos cruciais da nossa base:RelevÃ¢ncia: O dado precisa representar o fenÃ´meno que queremos prever. Se busco prever o churn (abandono), preciso do comportamento do cliente antes dele sair.Qualidade: Dados devem ser completos, consistentes e precisos, sem falhas de preenchimento ou duplicidade.Quantidade: Especialmente para Deep Learning e IA Generativa, uma grande quantidade de dados evita que o modelo apenas decore (overfitting), permitindo que ele generalize.Diversidade: Os dados devem refletir diferentes contextos e realidades para evitar vieses. [PT]O meu estÃ¡gio de verÃ£o na CGI chegou ao fim. Foram quatro semanas intensas e enriquecedoras, onde tive a oportunidade de explorar trÃªs Ã¡reas dentro do universo tecnolÃ³gico: Data Analytics, Robotic Process Automation (RPA) e Data Science.Esta foi a minha primeira experiÃªncia profissional e posso dizer, com toda a certeza, que foi especial. Ao longo deste mÃªs, mergulhÃ¡mos em projetos desafiantes em grupo, com entregas semanais e apresentaÃ§Ãµes que nos ajudaram a desenvolver nÃ£o sÃ³ competÃªncias tÃ©cnicas, mas tambÃ©m a capacidade de comunicar, colaborar e inovar. Tivemos formaÃ§Ãµes, conversas inspiradoras com profissionais de diferentes Ã¡reas da empresa e atÃ© com colaboradores de outras empresas, o que nos permitiu ganhar uma visÃ£o mais ampla do mundo da tecnologia e da consultoria.Esta experiÃªncia permitiu-me crescer enquanto futuro profissional e, acima de tudo, enquanto pessoa. Levo comigo aprendizagens, memÃ³rias e amizades que ficarÃ£o para sempre.Um agradecimento especial ao nosso coordenador de estÃ¡gio,JosÃ© Pratas, pela orientaÃ§Ã£o e motivaÃ§Ã£o ao longo de todo o percurso. E claro, a todos os estagiÃ¡rios, por terem tornado esta experiÃªncia ainda mais rica e memorÃ¡vel Ã  vossa maneira.Obrigado,CGI![ENG]My summer internship at CGI has come to an end. It was an intense and enriching four weeks, where I had the opportunity to explore three areas within the technology universe: Data Analytics, Robotic Process Automation (RPA), and Data Science.This was my first professional experience, and I can confidently say it was special. Throughout this month, we immersed ourselves in challenging group projects, with weekly deliverables and presentations that helped us develop not only technical skills but also our ability to communicate, collaborate, and innovate. We had training sessions and inspiring conversations with professionals from different areas of the company and even with employees from other companies, which allowed us to gain a broader perspective on the world of technology and consulting.This experience allowed me to grow as a future professional and, above all, as a person. I take with me lessons, memories, and friendships that will last forever.A special thanks to our internship coordinator,JosÃ© Pratas, for his guidance and motivation throughout the entire process. And of course, to all the interns, for making this experience even richer and more memorable in your own ways.Thank you,CGI!

A Courageous Land estÃ¡ com uma vaga de estÃ¡gio aberta para apoiar projetos de carbono em Afforestation, Reforestation and Revegetation (ARR), desenvolvidos a partir de metodologias reconhecidas internacionalmente, em especial o padrÃ£o Verra.Esta Ã© uma oportunidade para estudantes que desejam aprofundar seus conhecimentos na Ã¡rea, participando da anÃ¡lise de dados de biomassa e solo, organizaÃ§Ã£o de informaÃ§Ãµes para estimativas de remoÃ§Ã£o de carbono, e elaboraÃ§Ã£o de documentos tÃ©cnicos, como o Project Description (PD) e relatÃ³rios complementares.O estÃ¡gio oferece a chance de atuar em um ambiente de crescimento acelerado, que respira o propÃ³sito de reverter as mudanÃ§as climÃ¡ticas enquanto cria saÃºde e abundÃ¢ncia para toda vida na Terra.RequisitosBuscamos estudantes de CiÃªncias Ambientais, Engenharia Florestal, Engenharia Ambiental, Geografia, Economia, AdministraÃ§Ã£o ou Ã¡reas correlatas, com boa escrita tÃ©cnica em portuguÃªs e inglÃªs, domÃ­nio de Excel avanÃ§ado e perfil analÃ­tico, organizado e comunicativo. Conhecimentos em R e SIG sÃ£o diferenciais.BenefÃ­ciosBolsa auxÃ­lio compatÃ­vel com o mercado, alÃ©m de benefÃ­cios a definir conforme localidade e disponibilidade.LocalA atuaÃ§Ã£o serÃ¡ remota, com preferÃªncia para candidatos localizados em SÃ£o Paulo ou no Rio de Janeiro, considerando a possibilidade de reuniÃµes presenciais e viagens pontuais.Se vocÃª deseja construir uma carreira de impacto, inscreva-se pelo link:https://lnkd.in/dUeR4gWH-Courageous Land is offering an internship opportunity to support carbon projects in Afforestation, Reforestation and Revegetation (ARR), developed under internationally recognized methodologies, especially the Verra standard.This is an opportunity for students who want to deepen their knowledge in the field by participating in biomass and soil data analysis, organizing information for carbon removal estimates, and contributing to the drafting of technical documents such as the Project Description (PD) and complementary reports.The internship offers the chance to work in a fast-growing environment driven by the purpose of reversing climate change while creating health and abundance for all life on Earth.RequirementsWe are looking for students in Environmental Sciences, Forestry, Environmental Engineering, Geography, Economics, Business Administration, or related fields, with strong technical writing skills in Portuguese and English, advanced Excel proficiency, and an analytical, organized, and communicative profile. Knowledge of R and GIS is considered a plus.LocationThe position is remote, with preference for candidates based in SÃ£o Paulo or Rio de Janeiro, considering availability for occasional in-person meetings and travel.If you want to build a meaningful career, apply through the link:https://lnkd.in/dUeR4gWH

autor: LaboratÃ³rio de InstrumentaÃ§Ã£o e FÃ­sica Experimental de PartÃ­culas
texto: EstÃ£o abertas as inscriÃ§Ãµes para o LIP Internship Program 2025!De junho a setembro, os polos do LIP em Lisboa, Coimbra e Minho acolhem estudantes de fÃ­sica, engenharia e ciÃªncias para estÃ¡gios de investigaÃ§Ã£o em ambiente internacional.O programa inclui uma semana de formaÃ§Ã£o em fÃ­sica de partÃ­culas, instrumentaÃ§Ã£o e anÃ¡lise de dados, bem como a oportunidade de trabalhar em projetos de investigaÃ§Ã£o em curso no LIP.Mais informaÃ§Ãµes e inscriÃ§Ã£o - atÃ© dia 15 de Maio - emhttps://lnkd.in/dKNj4u7k**********Applications are now open for the LIP Internship Program 2025!From June to September, LIPâ€™s research centres in Lisbon, Coimbra and Minho host science, physics and engineering students for summer research internships in an international environment.The program includes an introductory training week on particle physics, instrumentation, and data analysis, as well as hands-on work on active research projects at LIP.More information and application - until May 15 - athttps://lnkd.in/dKNj4u7k

The Science of Circadian Rhythms and Health ğŸ§¬â°[Portuguese version at the end]Did you know your body has a biological clock that controls nearly everything? This is your circadian rhythm, a 24-hour cycle that influences your hormones, sleep, and even your body temperature.Research has shown that when these rhythms are disrupted, it can increase the risk of diseases like cancer and sleep disorders.A major challenge in this field is that the peak and trough of these rhythms vary from person to person. Ignoring this variability can lead to misleading conclusions in scientific studies.To address this, our team has developed a new statistical method: the Refined Two-Stage (RTS) Method.Our method improves the accuracy of data analysis, correcting for distortions and providing more power for hypothesis testing. This allows us to capture details of biological rhythms that other methods often miss.This work represents science and engineering working together to understand and protect our health.This project was developed atUniversidade Federal de RondÃ´nia, with support from theCNPq.

OlÃ¡, LinkedIn. Tudo bem?Dentro da proposta de relatar aspectos da minha pesquisa de doutorado, hoje venho falar de aprendizado (de coisas atÃ© simples). AlÃ©m de ser aluno de doutorado, trabalho tambÃ©m como pesquisador noIPT - Instituto de Pesquisas TecnolÃ³gicas. O IPT Ã© um lugar incrÃ­vel (que particularmente nÃ£o conhecia antes) que foi e Ã© protagonista de grandes avanÃ§os da ciÃªncia brasileira, e onde planejo desenvolver parte do meu doutorado. Dito isso, lembro que quando iniciei como estagiÃ¡rio, desenvolvi atividades no Tanque de Provas do IPT (uma piscina de 280m com trilhos nas laterais) e na Ã©poca me deparei com um desafio em conduzir experimentos com modelos na Ã¡gua: alÃ©m de considerar as condiÃ§Ãµes do ensaio (velocidade da Ã¡gua e posicionamento do modelo) tambÃ©m deveria levar em consideraÃ§Ã£o todos os sensores (como o da foto) que mediriam o que eu estava interessado. A ideia seria representar o fenÃ´meno de interesse e saber que este iria contar com a presenÃ§a de um sensor e que algumas hipÃ³teses e simplificaÃ§Ãµes devem ser consideradas. Aprendi uma liÃ§Ã£o que o sensor usado no experimento sempre medirÃ¡ algo se estiver ligado e a diferenÃ§a entre um dado â€œbomâ€ ou â€œruimâ€ Ã© a maneira como o sensor foi montado para o experimento. Um ex-colega, pesquisador sÃªnior jÃ¡ aposentado, na minha Ã©poca de estÃ¡gio dizia: â€œdados nÃ£o mentemâ€. Em outras palavras, tÃ£o importante quanto montar o experimento corretamente, Ã© montÃ¡-lo para medir o que vocÃª deseja (espero que nÃ£o tenha soado como discurso motivacional).What's up, LinkedIn?As part of the effort to share aspects of my PhD research, today I want to talk about learning (even simple things). In addition to being a PhD student, I also work as a researcher at IPT, an amazing place (which I personally didnâ€™t know before) that has been and continues to play an important role in Brazilian science, and where I intend to develop part of my PhD research. That said, I remember that when I first started as an intern, working in the IPT Towing Tank (a 280-meter pool with rails along the sides), and at the time I faced a challenge in conducting experiments with models in the water: in addition to considering the conditions of the test (water speed and model positioning), I also had to account for all the sensors (like the one in the photo) that would measure what I was interested in. The idea was to represent the phenomenon of interest, knowing that it would involve the presence of a sensor and that some hypotheses and simplifications would need to be considered. I learned a lesson that the sensor used in the experiment will always measure something if it is turned on, and the difference between "good" or "bad" data is the way the sensor was set up for the experiment. A former colleague used to say during my internship: "Data donâ€™t lie." In other words, as important as setting up the experiment correctly, it is equally important to set it up to measure what you want (I hope this doesnâ€™t sound like a motivational speech).

PT - ENGLanÃ§amento do Centro de DemonstraÃ§Ã£o e Pesquisas AgropecuÃ¡rias (CDPA)Ã‰ com grande entusiasmo que anunciamos a criaÃ§Ã£o do nosso primeiro Centro de DemonstraÃ§Ã£o e Pesquisas AgropecuÃ¡rias, localizado no povoado de Mphassi, Posto Administrativo de ZÃ³buÃ¨, Distrito de Moatize â€“ Tete, MoÃ§ambique.Banhado pelo rio Nkondedzi, este centro serÃ¡ um espaÃ§o dedicado Ã  inovaÃ§Ã£o, pesquisa e formaÃ§Ã£o de talentos, com os seguintes objetivos:1. Desenvolver e testar tecnologias agrÃ­colas sustentÃ¡veis;2. Promover demonstraÃ§Ãµes prÃ¡ticas e capacitaÃ§Ãµes para agricultores, jovens e tÃ©cnicos;3. Receber e incubar estÃ¡gios nas ciÃªncias agropecuÃ¡rias;4. Apoiar e/ou financiar Trabalhos de ConclusÃ£o de Curso (TCC) e Teses de estudantes interessados em desenvolver pesquisas agropecuÃ¡rias na regiÃ£o;5. Gerar dados e conhecimento aplicÃ¡vel sobre culturas estratÃ©gicas com foco em resiliÃªncia climÃ¡tica.O Centro da PELAGRA MoÃ§ambique serÃ¡ um laboratÃ³rio vivo, unindo pesquisa, inovaÃ§Ã£o e comunidade, com o objetivo de impulsionar a agricultura sustentÃ¡vel na provÃ­ncia de Tete e alÃ©m.A seguir, apresentamos alguns dados agroclimÃ¡ticos da Ã¡rea.PELAGRA MoÃ§ambique â€“ Do conhecimento, nasce uma nova agricultura._____________________________________________________________________Launch of the Agricultural Demonstration and Research Center (CDPA)We are delighted to announce the creation of our first Agricultural Demonstration and Research Center, located in the village of Mphassi, ZÃ³buÃ¨ Administrative Post, Moatize District â€“ Tete, Mozambique.Bordered by the Nkondedzi River, this center will be a space dedicated to innovation, research, and talent development, with the following objectives:1. Develop and test sustainable agricultural technologies;2. Promote practical demonstrations and training for farmers, youth, and technicians;3.
